Follow your calling to Austin Presbyterian Theological Seminary, a vibrant community where dynamic learners and leaders from diverse Christian traditions are moved to connect with their calling, challenge their assumptions, and change the world as they become confidently equipped for Christian ministry and service.
Flourish in who you are and who God is calling you to be.

Take a virtual tour of our campus
A good long walk. Preferably 500 miles on the Camino. But 5 miles around Ladybird Lake is my local treat.
Why did you choose your field?
In junior high school I started collecting church bulletins and printed copies of the ministers’ sermons. Why? What we did on Sunday mornings seemed urgent and I wanted to know more.
is not the best movie of all time. Music by Philip Glass has saved me from despair on more than one occasion.
I keep my cell phone turned off ninety percent of the time. This is much cheaper than psychotherapy.
What do you like about teaching at Austin Seminary?
This is a place that encourages intellectual and spiritual adventuring, exploring the unknown and sampling the exotic, all the while remaining grounded in deep conversation with the tradition.

There are many ways to partner with Austin Seminary in the formation of men and women for Christian ministry.
Gifts that support the day to day operations are as welcomed as those that sustain our mission into the future.
Making a gift to Austin Seminary is as simple as
You may support Austin Seminary students by sending a check, made payable to APTS, to the Office of Institutional Advancement, 100 E 27th St., Austin, TX 78705.
Our staff is here to receive your calls, answer any questions, and take your donation. Call Sharon Sandberg at 512-404-4886. Visa, American Express, MasterCard and Discover are welcomed.
Gifts of appreciated stocks benefit Austin Seminary and you. Call Al Krummencher at 512-404-4803 to discuss your gift of appreciated stock.

If you are age 70½ years or older, a direct transfer from your IRA is a convenient way to ease the tax burden of your annual required minimum distribution (RMD). Contact your IRA custodian to set it up.
Become a Partner by making a pledge of support over time. We will remind you when a gift is scheduled.
Become a Sustainer by making a gift on a recurring basis
Your employer may sponsor a matching gift program that will match your charitable contributions—sometimes doubling or tripling your gift.
By naming Austin Seminary in your estate you will provide a lasting gift. Call Donna Scott at 512-404-4807.
Annual gifts support the day-to-day operation of Austin Seminary.
Gifts to the endowment are pooled and invested. Interest and income are used to support the mission of Austin Seminary in perpetuity.
Offer a tribute to family, friends, or faculty members who have made an impact on your life.

Charitable gift planning is your way to leave a legacy after you are gone. Estate gifts can be made in the form of a bequest, or you can name Austin Seminary as a beneficiary in a trust, a unitrust, gift annuity, or insurance policy. Call Donna Scott, 512-404-4807.

Website/Portal Policy on Protection of Personal Information

Austin Presbyterian Theological Seminary is concerned about the protecting the personal information of alumni, donors, students, faculty, staff, and prospective students as they use the Austin Seminary website and portals.
We do not sell, rent, or loan personal information to others.
We request and use only that information required for legitimate business purposes.
We protect the integrity of all personal information in our records.
We permit limit access to personal information to only those persons who need it to perform their duties.
We only allow password-protected, opt-in directories to respective groups: student to student and faculty/staff; faculty/staff to faculty/staff and students; and alumni to alumni and faculty/staff.
When you request information be sent to you or when you fill out an online application, we enter your information in our admissions database so we can contact you in the future.

When you make a gift online, you provide us with information we need, which includes your name, address, phone numbers, email address, and credit card information. If you make a gift via check or electronic funds transfer, you also give us bank account information. The Seminary does not store credit card or bank account information in its electronic database. Austin Seminary uses The Raiser’s Edge for donor data storage and online giving; The Raiser’s Edge is PCI DSS Compliant.

You may opt-out from receiving communications from Austin Presbyterian Theological Seminary at any time by notifying us. Please contact us by mail, phone, or email and include your complete name and address:
With Regard to Austin Seminary Website

We do not obtain personal information about you when you visit our website unless you voluntarily provide the information to us when you send us an email, register for a Seminary event, request information from us, or make a gift online.

Our web server automatically compiles conventional log files that we use to monitor website activity. These logs do not identify individual users. When you make a gift online you are directed to Blackbaud.com. You can access their privacy policy from our giving page. Our website utilizes cookies to enhance your online experience.

Austin Seminary website has four portals: admissions, students, faculty/staff, and alumni. Each portal is login-protected and only those respective groups and website staff have access to the portals. Any directories found on portals are opt-in directories and never shared with anyone without password-protected portal access.
For questions about this policy please contact:
Donna Scott, Vice President for Institutional Advancement
